title: Drawing, "Copy of Competition Design by Vanvitelli for the Facade of S. Giovanni in Laterano", 1763, after a drawing of 1732
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and grey wash over graphite on laid paper
inscribed: 'Idea della Facciata per S. Giovanni in Laterano del Vanvitelli da me disegnata nel 1763."
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Steps lead toa colonnade. A loggia is in the upper story, closed by a wall with a window in its rear part. Many columns, pilasters and statues are used as decorations. A crouching figure holds a key in the right corner of the dado of the upper story.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Copy of Competition Design by Vanvitelli for the Facade of S. Giovanni in Laterano", 1763, after a drawing of 1732.
1763, after a drawing of 1732. Pen and black ink, brush and grey wash over graphite on laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-7445.
